title: What is the relationship between equals() and hashCode()?

answers.junior: equals() checks if two objects are equal. hashCode() returns a number for the object. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
answers.middle: Contract: if two objects are equal via equals(), they must have the same hashCode(). Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Important for HashMap and HashSet functionality.
answers.senior: The contract ensures correct behavior in hash-based collections. Override both consistently or neither. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Use Objects.equals() and Objects.hash() for implementation.
answers.tricky: Discuss hashCode distribution, collision handling, performance implications, and mutable objects in hash collections. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Consider IdentityHashMap exceptions.
